titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Walter Savage Landor Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:03
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, printed material, and artwork by or relating to Walter Savage Landor. Correspondence includes 12 ALS to William Allingham, an open letter to Ralph Waldo Emerson, and 2 ALS to Frances Milton Trollope. The writings include three sets of proof-sheets for Dry Sticks, a printed copy of Gebir, Count Julian, and other poems, with copious ms. corrections, excisions, etc. Accompanying material includes three pencil portraits of Landor by William Wetmore Story.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the box-and-folder list. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Walter Savage Landor Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Walter Savage Landor Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Restricted Fragile Papers in the broadside folder may only be consulted with permission of the appropriate curator. Preservation photocopies for reference use have been substituted in the main files.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from previously existing cards in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, it has been noted in the box-and-folder list. This finding aid will be updated periodically to account for new materials that may be added to the collection. The date of the most recent update is noted on the title page. For information on material that may have been added since the last update, please consult the Public Service Desk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to Walter Savage Landor, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection. Materials given by George Arents are organized into the first series. Materials given by Ray L. Murphy are organized into the second series. Additional materials comprise the third series.

Original Dedication to the First Edition of Landor's Writings, printed copy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: According to a note by Allingham, the first part of the letter of 27 Apr 1853 was destroyed at Landor's request; the letter of 28 July 1853 contains a draft of a letter from Landor to Monckton Milnes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This open letter was printed in pamphlet form shortly after it was written

did.unittitle: 2 ALS to G. J. Holyoake, Florence
Draft of a letter to Monckton Milnes
Dry Sticks. Three sets of proof-sheets, and five additional signatures

"Proper Lesson for Charles's Martyrdom," autograph ms., signed

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mounted on sheet of paper together with an envelope addressed to Henry Stephens, and a printed copy of the "Proper Lesson..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by a letter from Prof. C. B. Tinker to William Lyon Phelps, presenting the manuscript to the latter, dated 1932 Oct 1. Also accompanied by a letter from Andrew Keogh to William Lyon Phelps, concerning the first publication of the sonnet. Letter dated 1934 Jul 23

did.unittitle: Three pencil portraits of Walter Savage Landor, signed W. W. S. [William Wetmore Story], Siena

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For information about the origin of these sketches, see M.F. Ashley- Montagu's "Three unknown portraits of Walter Savage Landor" in "The Colophon", n.s., v.2, no.2, p. 257-62. Accompanied by four TLS from Elmer Adler to Russell G. Pruden Jul 9-Sep 23, 1936, concerning the article in "The Colophon" Gift, 1949

did.unittitle: Imaginary Conversation of King Carlo- Alberto and the Duchess Belgioioso on the Affairs and Prospects of Italy, autograph manuscript of pages [3]-9 of the printed text

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by ANS to his publisher, Newby, asking that copies of his last volume be sent to Mr. Forster and Mr. Browning

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
